p: Since F-IAV is more virulent than M-IAV in the murine model [ 5], we tested whether these distinct capacities to generate DVGs were apparent in vivo; the accumulation of DVGs and viral genome was analyzed in the lungs of M- and F-IAV-infected mice. In whole lung tissue ( S5A Fig) and in virions purified from lung ( S5B Fig), DVGs accumulation was greater in M- than in F-IAV-infected mice. There is thus a clear correlation between DVGs accumulation mediated by F- and M-IAV and their pathogenicity in the murine model [ 5].
